meanings.definition: A person who is not a main partner in a romantic or sexual relationship.
meanings.sent1: She knew she was just one of his jumpoffs, not his true love.
meanings.sent2: He had multiple jumpoffs while he was still dating someone else.
meanings.sent3: The jumpoffs all gathered at the party, unaware of each other's existence.
meanings.sent4: In the world of dating, jumpoffs are like temporary placeholders.
meanings.sent5: Being a jumpoff can sometimes lead to heartbreak and disappointment.

meanings.sent1: He didn't want a serious relationship, just a few jumpoffs here and there.
meanings.sent2: She enjoyed the freedom of being a jumpoff without any commitment.
meanings.sent3: Their arrangement was simple - she was his jumpoff on weekends.
meanings.sent4: To him, she was just a temporary jumpoff in his otherwise busy life.
meanings.sent5: Being a jumpoff can be exciting but also risky in terms of emotions.

meanings.sent1: Their fling was nothing more than a brief jumpoff during summer.
meanings.sent2: She knew their connection was just a temporary jumpoff before he moved away.
meanings.sent3: Their jumpoff was like a summer breeze - refreshing but fleeting.
meanings.sent4: In the world of casual dating, jumpoffs come and go like seasons.
meanings.sent5: The jumpoff ended as quickly as it began, leaving them both wondering.
